MIMOSA
Three golden syllables, delightfully scented, sun-kissed and overflowing with joy, that naturally evoke the sun and the Mediterranean...



COMING EARLY 2024
                





 
A SOLAR ATMOSPHERE AND AN ODE TO THE RIVIERA
MIMOSA combines the very best of the South of France, with the exquisite Italian lifestyle; beauty, bliss and joy. Complete with a stunning décor, a carefully curated team of experts and a menu of sophisticated dishes, we have produced the perfect set of ingredients for a brand new, contemporary and breathtaking “art de vivre”.
 
 
AN EGGS MIMOSA BAR 
A symbol of the Riviera’s sunshine and warmth, our famous egg mimosa is a simple delicacy that has delighted many of our guests, past and present. Here in MIMOSA, the iconic egg mimosa will be served in a variety of ways, such as a Niçois tapas, perfect to be shared and enjoyed.
 
 
A MENU FULL OF GENEROSITY 
From Saint-Tropez to the Italian Riviera, passing through Nice and Menton, the Côte d’Azur has a glorious reputation for its menu specialties and fresh produce.
 
From blue lobster from Brittany paired with aioli, fresh grilled octopus, chickpeas, and coriander to succulent veal paillard, riquette, tomato and olives cooked over a wood fire or grill, these dishes will provide the perfect combination of the freshest elements from the land and the sea.
 
Seasonal confits vegetables in olive oil are cooked over a wood fire to provide the utmost flavour, alongside a selection of fresh herbs; an ode to the southern French cuisine. Each carefully curated ingredient, flavour and dish oozes the sun-drenched South of France and the Riviera spirit that MIMOSA endeavour to recreate right in the heart of the West End.
  
 
A MAGICAL TERRACE 
Hidden within The Langham’s courtyard lies the beautiful garden terrace; a blooming garden adjoining the restaurant which will open it’s doors to guests during the warm months in spring and summer. This is an idyllic, lush outdoor space perfect for hosting an array of events, such as lunches and dinners with a dedicated menu comprising of delicious grilled dishes, bursting with the distinctive and unique flavour of the Côte d'Azur: the famous slow life.

The Congestion Charge is a £15 daily charge if you drive within the zone from 7am – 10pm every day, except for Christmas Day (25 December). If your vehicle does not meet the Ultra Low Emission Zone (ULEZ) standards, you must also pay the ULEZ charge. To learn more, visit the TFL Congestion Charge website.

We offer private transfers for your convenience and comfort. To increase the safety of our guests and staff, our Mercedes Benz V-Class Extra Long Wheelbase fleet has been retrofitted with bespoke fabricated partitions between chauffeur and passenger compartments.

OUR NEIGHBOURHOOD

There's more to London than Big Ben and iconic red buses. Experience the best of this electrifying city with our insider guide on what to see, eat, and do.

Enjoy a wondrous family holiday with our tailored Children’s Programme. With a range of specially designed amenities and fun classes, your little ones are in for an exciting treat!

PET POLICY

Dogs 12 kilos or less are allowed in all rooms. A fee of  £100 per stay, per dog will apply. An additional sanitation fee may also apply. Dogs must be kept on a leash in public areas and cannot be left alone in guest room.
 
They are allowed in The Wigmore, but they are not allowed in any other Food and Beverage outlets, Club Lounge or the Spa.

ENQUIRY




















CORPORATE SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY

As an environmentally conscious hotel, The Langham, London is committed to reducing its operating footprint. To preserve our world for future generations, we have applied policies and initiatives to meet our underlying responsibilities. 
 
We also seek to build closer relationships with our local community. To achieve this, we have an annual community involvement programme to provide volunteering opportunities for our staff.

ACCESSIBLE FACILITIES

At The Langham, London, we are committed to ensuring the comfort and safety of every guest. The Langham, London’s facilities are in compliance with The Equality Act of 2010.

OUR STORY

In 1865, The Langham, London first opened its doors. Recognised as Europe’s first ‘Grand Hotel’, it sought to revolutionise the luxury hotel experience.
 
157 years later, many things have changed, but the hotel remains one of the world’s most iconic hotels — famed for its legendary hospitality. Along with an innovative spirit and playful, pink heritage, The Langham, London continues to captivate.
 
Take a walk with us, and discover our history.

THE GOOD FRONT ROOM
CLOSING SOON
 
Chef Dom Taylor's pop-up Caribbean restaurant, The Good Front Room will close its doors on 30th April 2024. Book your table now before it's too late!
 
 
The Good Front Room tells a story of beloved childhood memories. Myrtle, Chef Dominic Taylor’s great aunt, lived in a house filled with trinkets and keepsakes, a magical playground to explore as children. One room however was sacred, its entrance prohibited, always immaculately set up to receive ‘a very special guest’ and so, The Good Front Room. 
 
As you dine with us, you are that special guest and we invite you to indulge in the experience of The Good Front Room at the Langham, London.

ABOUT CHEF DOM TAYLOR


Dominic Taylor, professionally known as Chef Dom Taylor, is a South East London based freelance chef with a deep passion and love for Caribbean food. His classical training, industry experience, love of travel and the arts, and sacred family teachings are the backdrop to everything he does. He is on a mission to recreate, modernise, and ignite a new lease of life into Caribbean cookery. 
 
Chef Dom was crowned winner of Channel 4 and Netflix's, Five Star Kitchen, in the grand finale that was judged by The Langham, London's Culinary Director and two-star Michelin Chef, Michel Roux Jr. , thus launching his first ever restaurant, The Good Front Room at Palm Court.

Enjoy a wondrous family holiday with our tailored Children’s Activities. With a range of specially designed amenities and fun classes, your little ones are in for an exciting treat!












EXCLUSIVE PROGRAMMES




















KIDS BAKING CLASSES

You're never too young to discover the joys of baking. Our friendly team at Sauce by The Langham will teach your kids the basics of baking, and help them gain confidence in the kitchen. Participants will also walk away with tasty cookies, muffins or cakes.

CHILDREN’S AMENITIES

Our dedicated children’s check-in marks the exciting start to your child’s stay. Every guest will receive a special set of amenities, from a Theodore teddy bear to adorable bear-themed loungewear.





















ACTIVITY BOOKLET

Children aged 2 to 10 will receive an activity booklet that encourages exploration of our historic hotel. At each outlet, kids can collect special stamps from our hotel staff. Complete the booklet to redeem a tasty treat!





















BABYSITTING SERVICES

We offer professional babysitting services so you can have a kid-free night out. Rates start from £14.50/hour, with a minimum booking of 4 hours. A £25 booking fee is also applicable.

Guests aged 12 and under enjoy 50% off in our restaurants. Children’s menus are also available.

There's more to London than Big Ben and iconic red buses. Experience the best of this electrifying city with our insider guide on what to see, eat, and do.













10 EXPERIENCES YOU CAN’T MISS 

London is full of world-class attractions and famous landmarks. And The Langham neighbourhood, right in the heart of the city, is the perfect base for your adventure.
 
But if you find sightseeing dull, spice up your itinerary with these 10 unusual activities — located just 10 minutes away from the hotel.

If you tire of the city's hustle and bustle, escape to Hyde Park. This lush, magical sanctuary is London's most prominent park, perfect for strolls and jogs all year-round. But for a unique experience, head to the Speakers' Corner to share your views or debate with strangers on any topic.

Since 1837, Buckingham Palace has served as the official London residence of the British sovereigns. Today, this beloved landmark serves as the administrative headquarters for Queen Elizabeth II.

OXFORD STREET
Oxford Street is the ultimate shopper’s paradise. It offers over 2.4km (or 1.5 miles) of fashion, beauty and lifestyle brands, peppered with over 500 eateries. Occasionally, Oxford Street hosts pop-up festivals and events — adding to its lively vibe.

Bond Street is one of London's most iconic streets. Hailed as a luxury hotspot, you'll find a wealth of high-end brands, designer fashion, and fine-dining restaurants.
